witness in the biggest Public Health reform issue in US history does he go on television and tell the truth yes are we gonna hear it of course not Russell Crowe I thought for you and I still fight who is this where there's smoke there's fire dr. wagons deposition will be part of this record you go public nothing will ever be the same The Insider a Michael Mann film rated R

The Insider it purports to be based on the actual event surrounding former Brown & Williamson employee Jeffrey wigand his relationship with CBS News and the now Infamous interview he gave 60 Minutes news magazine but there is a lot of controversy surrounding the factual basis of the screenplay most everyone who was involved with the real life news account from Mike Wallace to Wygant himself disputes their portrayal in the movie they're angry that the producers have taken creative license with the truth for the

like of entertainment in other words the Hollywood version of the script is designed to sell tickets not to accurately portray history as one 60-minute producer puts it this movie is purely about putting Fanny's and seats and has nothing to do with the truth this program is to provide you with a different perspective on The Insider it's total sensationalism it's not the company that I work for Brown & Williamson I've worked for the company for almost nine years as an ethical Corporation I don't see the

people that I know being the people that were portrayed in the trailer and so I find that very concerning CEO Nick Brooks shares those concerns well there's not a cute old man and even while I can understand it but of course we're only working ready from the trailer and the commentaries that we've read in the newspapers and magazines but I must say it's very very frustrating not to be able to be able to influence any part of the script what in particular and the movie

is most disturbing to you okay we're ready to things that get to me the first I think is the way in which it treats my predecessor told me Sandifer who's now of course passed on you can't defame the dead and I'll ensure the Hollywood Moguls know that and therefore they really have taken outrageous liberties with his character and I think that that really is I feel very badly for his memory and for his family and friends of course who survived him well the other thing that really

Freddy's frustrates me is the way that they are portraying particularly in the trailer that is is on the internet so I viewed that this this allegation that that he was threatened his family was threatened by Brown & Williamson there's a shot in the trailer that I've seen where you see a bullet left in a mailbox and the clear implication is that it was a threat from the company the very very egregious thing about this movie is of course they calling it a true story and there's absolutely nothing true about this story while previews

on the world wide web to healthy and cider as a true story there is as much if not more controversy surrounding the screenplay as there was surrounding Jeffrey wigand when he first came to like five years ago from 1989 until 1993 weigand was the vice president of research and development at Brown & Williamson he was fired and soon became a paid consultant to CBS news on a tobacco related story two years later cbs's 60 Minutes news magazine was about to air an interview with the disgruntled weigand this

the fact he had voluntarily signed a confidentiality agreement with BMW which prevented him from discussing Trade Secrets when CBS decided not to run the interview a media frenzy ensued the original interview was eventually broadcast a later narrative on the entire incident in Vanity Fair magazine is the basis for the dramatization or docudrama now being created by Touchstone pictures and even that is suspect we took Jeffrey wagons deposition in

1997 and we showed him excerpts from that article we showed him quotes that were attributed to him in that article and Jeffrey wigand denied under oath that he had made those quotes he had denied under oath that that story was accurate he had denied under oath that he had told Marie Brunner the things that were attributed to him in that article among those expressing dismay over the Insiders and accurate portrayal of history is Lucretia nemec's wagons former wife she claims the film's director Michael Mann

X major creative liberties with the truth and even makes up events for the sake of entertainment why are you talking I mean why are you talking especially to Brown & Williamson who your ex-husband saw as his nemesis

for several reasons what I don't think what the movie is doing is right because it's not the truth there is very little truth going on in this movie and that's unfortunate because most people read the paper or read the magazine or look at the movie and they think this really happened when it didn't have it I have friends that work at Brown & Williamson there were women that called me even after Jeff was fired

that wanted to continue the our friendship and and they were very sweet to me so and my husband has some friends that has worked for Ronald Williamson in the past he grew up with folks we realize that there are people here that do a job and they're going to see this and think this really happened this was this is real tell me what's going through your mind and anticipation of what's going to be on the big screen

a lot of different issues I want I would have appreciated them Consulting me they're using my character and they haven't asked me word one about how do you feel is this accurate are we doing things the right way as far as you in the movie you are portrayed as running from the house to him screaming with your daughter's in fear
that's in the trailer I've seen it right is that accurate No that never happened

what did happen I came home from work and I know that Jeff knew about the divorce but I was still cordial I said hello I went downstairs to to say hi I'm home and he was sitting at his desk with black leather gloves on and I'm like what are you doing but he was he said he was cold so I said well I'm home and I went upstairs and dinner and dishes and kids and baths and so on and so

fourth and sometime later in the evening he called for his oldest daughter my stuff taught her to come and take some mail out to the mailbox and he asked her repeatedly two or three times what she was going to the post office in the morning so she was just going to take it to the regular post office so she laid it on the dining room table and somewhere between 10:00 and 11:00 he took the dog out for a walk and
took the mail and found the bullet and the death threat and the death threat specifically threatens children

tonight the threat came I was speaking with with my stepdaughter and it was we were looking at each other are you thinking what I'm thinking and we both thought that he had put the threat in the mailbox now why would you think that because of the situation and the way it all happened and and him wanting her to go out to the mailbox and kept asking her and then the black gloves at the computer desk and the way

way the letters formatted it was all caps that's the way Jeff writes memos all caps it just it was a gut feeling and that threat is believed to have been fabricated by Jeffrey that's my belief because I was there on that evening during the set of circumstances did you tell that to the police
or the FBI they ask me

so yes they asked me and I wasn't going to lie to the FBI so the FBI seized the hard drive on our computer and it went to Washington for analysis and so on and so forth when the hard drive was returned and I spoke with the agent who was in charge of the operation he told me that he felt like the threat had not come from outside the house
like threat came from inside my house how did that make you feel when he told you that I would it make you feel I was scared to death
who are you scared of Jeff

I wasn't afraid of Brown & Williamson was I afraid of CBS yes a little bit because they had gotten so involved in my life there were people following me around there were people in my home all the time the whole story leaked and at that point in time CBS ordered security or gave us the idea that we needed Security in our home 24/7 so they hired security agents and

they came in and they did a sweep for hidden microphones and it's like in the movies and they escorted my children to school me to work and Jeff wherever he went there were supposedly some calls that were made to Jeff threatening calls they traced those calls and at the time those calls were made they weren't 30 second cause they weren't a minute call they weren't 10-second calls they
these calls at the time that he said he was threatened or 10-15 minute calls well I don't think he threatened people for 10 or 15 minutes so you think he made it up

yes how do you do do you think he made it up for publicity or he made it up because he was going to have another one of his stories and have something happen think it made a good story for him I think that Jeff has

a problem with truth he's he makes up stories to tell and they're great stories and then he believes those stories a lot of people see him as doing great things for this country have you seen Wag the Dog
that's what I see they have created a hero
because they needed one at the time and the issues are all right it's tobacco issue and they needed a hero and he was a vice president so he's the best hero they could get

unfortunately he has water hero there were people that were paid by CBS to come in and do damage control for the Jeff image they were out of California and I think they worked on the Clinton Administration when he was getting elected powerful people so there are many people that worked on damage control of what was going on at the time the movie I think portrays you as crumbling

as your marriage crumbling from the stress of his coming forward with information is that accurate to know my marriage was crumbling away before the the situation happen with CBS and all of those issues tobacco in the tobacco issue didn't kill my marriage a people at Brown & Williamson are who we're actually talking to today

would you say anything to them I hope they take everything with a big Shaker of salt not a green because there isn't much as far as my life portrayed in the movie that's really based on fact would you say anything to the general public who's going to see this movie this is strictly entertainment this isn't real
but at the expense of you we're daughters well that's a situation I have to live with
and I can't change it

Disney has broken a Hollywood tradition by identifying those companies by name concerns over the inside or in other movies at dramatized history like silkwood a civil action and even JFK are that the audience doesn't know what's real and historically accurate and what's being created for dramatic effect leaving a skewed perception of actual events historian Thomas Mackey says the blurring of lines has been occurring for years but is of growing concern it is troubling when they are

are there are based on true episodes or incidents or issues that did occur but then in the telling of them of course they then take the dramatic license their add characters they delete characters they change the issues they ignore the evidence in order to build what the filmmaker needs which is a dramatic story but then students will go look at it general public will go look at this and believe that in fact what they're getting is history and that usually very different the JFK

being an excellent example of it may be an interesting film it's really bad history even Mike Wallace has been quoted as asking where does the truth end and entertainment began I have three kids and the first time that I saw the trailer for this movie I was in a theater with my son I had to sit down and have a discussion with him about it I had to explain to him that his father doesn't put bullets in people's mailboxes his father doesn't threaten people's lives that's a discussion I never should have had to have

I suspect that the executives at Disney who are responsible for this movie wouldn't want to have that conversation with their kids either to me Disney has always been family entertainment and this is the misrepresentation of company and good corporate citizen to me is not entertainment and I just really don't understand the basis for another question many of you may have is why doesn't Brown & Williamson take legal action will

going to have to look at the movie almost shot by Shot line by line and work with our lawyers to determine whether or not we have been defamed in a way that will give us an appropriate course of action it's not likely that the debate over this type of movie and specifically The Insider will end any time soon and brown and Williamson is reluctant to take any action before the movie is released because it doesn't want to generate any further publicity for the film what BMW realizes though is that each of you is Brown & Williamson

listen if you could say anything to the employees out there who are going to have to deal with the Fallout of this movie how large or how small what would it be I think I'd say you'll company hasn't changed this movie is a misrepresentation of the events and historic events it's a mischaracterization of your your previous leader Tommy Sandifer it's just factually wrong and your company is still the same company that you worked for

yesterday and will work for tomorrow is a responsible company it knows it's in a controversial industry but it's a responsible company trying to do the right thing it only wants to work with people of Integrity such as yourselves that's why we employ doing that's why we'll go on employing you it's hoped this program will be helpful for each of you and concluding that in fact the new Disney Touchstone film The Insider is a movie for entertainment purposes only and that it in no way accurately represents the facts surrounding the Jeffrey wigand case thank you for taking time to
to watch
